description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Bridger Tent: 6-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Bridger Tent: 6-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Bridger Tent: 6-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I would 100% suggest this tent to car campers and anyone who needs a base camp. The tent is priced very high, but it is always on sale on multiple websites. When I was searching online, I bought the 6-person tent because it was cheaper than the 4-person tent.

Full Review at tentanddog.com
review.name: This Could Be Considered Glamping

review.reviewBody: I bought this tent for my family of 4 and a dog.  It is huge!  Great quality, easy to set up.  Everything I hoped it would be.  It looks like it will last many years to come.
review.name: Awesome tent

review.reviewBody: This tent is spacious and well-designed. Plenty of pockets for storage, plenty of mesh for ventilation, great options for opening the vestibule (roll up the front for easy entry/extra shade, roll back the sides on rainy days). Check the dimensions, as this tent is HUGE. We are a family of four and typically buy 6-person tents so we have plenty of room to sleep and keep all of our gear. The vestibule of this tent is huge and we can easily fit all of our gear without having to bring any of it in the tent. We have even stored our bikes in the vestibule to keep them out of the rain. In hindsight, we could easily use the 4-person version of this and kept our gear in the vestibule. There are definitely areas where finding the space to set this tent up can be challenging. If you have the space though, this thing is great!
review.name: Well Designed Tent

review.reviewBody: First camping trip was raining. The zippers on the vestibule area are horrible. They get stuck in the protective flap every time. So frustrating. After two days of rain there was water on the floor inside the tent coming through the seams. While taking it down the poles pulled apart. The bungee cord inside just pulled right through with hardly any effort. The only good thing was that the interior walls stayed dry because of the rain fly.
review.name: Dont buy it.

review.reviewBody: After our last tent poles broke, which was only 4 years old, we were looking for a nice size family tent. This one was on sale and seemed to fit what we needed. Even though set up is more time consuming than our last tent, we definitely have more space and the oversized vestibule was handy on a rainy morning. Cant speak to how well it will last, but it kept us dry and four of us and the dog had enough space.
review.name: Great Family size

review.reviewBody: Quality exceptionally made. Would purchase again. Great brand
review.name: Very well made.

review.reviewBody: Great Tent- easy to put up- sturdy- breathable - poles are very nice!
review.name: Great Tent

review.reviewBody: AWESOME TENT! Seriously, the features are great, set up is easy. It's the perfect set up for a boujee camping trip. 10/10 would buy again
review.name: Buy this tent!

review.reviewBody: Um... Yeah, this is the best. I like to camp in comfort and style. This matches all of it. The tent poles are strong and sturdy and make me feel comfortable in wind. The large parch offers a nice shaded place to relax when needed, and obviously ample room for storage. The ability to stand up all the way very comfortable as a 6ft tall person is a game changer.
review.name: Definitely a good product

review.reviewBody: Large enough to fit my needs, easily fits cots, easy to set up, easy to role back the fly so you so can see the stars.  I also appreciate it was the only tent of this size that I shopped for that came with a footprint cons I replaced the tie down cords to 3 mil cord P cord always slips, takes a little practice to put tent fly and footprint back in the bag.  Id recommend the tent
review.name: Looking for room

name: Bridger Tent: 6-Person 3-Season

description: Buy the Nathan Vapor Air 3.0 7L Hydration Pack online or shop all Run from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Vapor Air 3.0 7L Hydration Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nathan Vapor Air 3.0 7L Hydration Pack online or shop all Run from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Vapor Air 3.0 7L Hydration Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nathan Vapor Air 3.0 7L Hydration Pack online or shop all Run from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Purchased a size too small and returned it and got another size, Nathan made the process very easy.  Love the fit and numerous pockets for storage and customization.  Would be nice if Nathan made a product that would air out the bladder so it would dry.  Thanks.
review.name: Nice for a bigger man

review.reviewBody: So far I love the pack.  Works great, allows to carry enough water and supplies for long runs when water is not available.  The Sizing for Nathan packs is not consistent however.  It took me three attempts to get the sizing right for Nathan packs.  I first tried the VaporAir Light and ordered it in the L-XXL Size.  When it came it was extremely small and no amount of adjusting could allow it to fit me.  With that I switched and ordered the VaporAir 3.0 in the 1X-3X size as it was for people with bigger shoulders.  This one was way too big and I couldn't get it synched down enough to not just fall off of me.  I exchanged this for the L-XXL size and thankfully this time the L-XXL size fit.  It actually is almost too big as I have all of the straps and adjustment snugged down as tight as they will go and it barely fits.  I am not a small guy (5'11'' and 230 lbs) and haven't fit into a medium size since I was a Sophomore in high school.
review.name: Great Pack but sizing seems way off

review.reviewBody: Years ago I tried a non-nathan hydration vest... it was awful.  That led me to 7 years of crazy long runs with handheld...   I thought I'd give the VaporAir 3.0 a try and could not be more satisfied.  The vest does not bounce, pocket placement is perfect, it has room to carry everything one needs for a long day out.   I've even been known to grab it over my day pack for hiking.
review.name: Evolution....

review.reviewBody: Love the features and all the pockets of the vest. The bladder is great and feels like it will last a long time. I would give it 5 stars but I think the sizing is a little off.  You either have to order XS-M or LXXL.  Im 60 180 lbs and the L-XXL still feels a little loose with everything all the way tightened down.
review.name: Great vest

review.reviewBody: The choice of VaporAir 3.0 was straightforward after years of using the two previous generations for most of my long runs. The 3.0 is an excellent vest with some improvements over its predecessors, but you should pay special attention to the sizing chart. At 1.83m/83kg (6"/185lbs), I have always used the L-XXL, but with the 3.0, I surprisingly should have chosen the XS-M, sizes I haven't met since primary school.
review.name: Great vest with a sizing issue

review.reviewBody: Great for ultra training and self-supported long runs between 20 - 25 miles without access to running water.
review.name: Great for 20 mile self-supported runs

review.reviewBody: I decided to replace my Nathan hydration vest that I purchased in 2013 with the VaporAir 3.0 7 liter vest and I have made several 18 plus mile training runs with it. It is much better than my old Nathan vest and worth the purchase. Fit, carrying capacity and color of course, are perfect for my trail running in Montana.
review.name: Good Fit and Ample pockets

review.reviewBody: Im not a runner (any longer..too many miles too hard when younger, get injuries too easily now). I use this pack for mountain biking. My bike has barely enough room so one small water bottle.  This pack allows me to carry plenty of fluids, has nice pockets for energy gels and bars or whatever food I need, plus the zippered cargo pocket on the back can hold my tools, frame pump and emergency clothing if the weather turns foul. My main reason for getting the pack was to be able to carry bear spray on my person. Living in Alaska means I can see a bear even when riding somewhat urban bike trails. Ive always carried bear spray in a handlebar mounted feed bag, but its easy to get separated from my bike when startled by a seeming aggressive bear. The pockets on the shoulder straps easily hold a can of bear spray. It serves exactly the purpose for which I bought it.
review.name: Nice pack even for non-runners!

review.reviewBody: Worth every cent. Had no issues with chaffing on my long runs and love all the storage it has.
review.name: Exceeded all expectations

review.reviewBody: This is an upgrade to a Nathan pack that I have had for 10 years. Much improved fit & functionality. The many adjustments make it perfect for a snug fit for running.
review.name: Excellent Fit & Functionality

name: Vapor Air 3.0 7L Hydration Pack

hasVariant.description: Buy the So iLL Street LV Climbing Shoe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: As someone with narrow feet Ive struggled to find climbing shoes that work for me. Usually the heel is baggy or my heel slides out of the shoe altogether. Ive been thrilled to find that these shoes couldnt fit me more perfectly. They are also exactly what I was looking for in an intermediate shoe to bridge between my beginner shoes and a more performance model. Previously Id been hesitant to try So iLL due to some negative reviews and issues Id heard about with the shoes, but the complete redesign theyve done with these is awesome. Also love that that theyre vegan. Only complaint is the sizing - they recommend getting your street shoe size, and that was way to small for me, particularly for a shoe that isnt supposed to be performance. I ended up sizing up an entire size from my street shoe and they are quite snug still, but a perfect fit.
review.name: Love these shoes

name: Street LV Climbing Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Lofoten GORE-TEX PRO Plus Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: These Lofoten Gore-Tex Pro Plus pants are the best snow pants on the market. They have pockets in all the right places, vents strategically placed, and a removable bib. They have an adjustable waist, adjustable cuff closer for boots/ski boots. They are definitely worth the money.
review.name: The Perfect Snowpant

review.itemreviewed: Lofoten GORE-TEX PRO Plus Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I normally wear XL, but XL in these pants was far too small. I returned them. I'm not even sure if XXL would have been the right size for me.
review.name: Funky Sizing

review.itemreviewed: Lofoten GORE-TEX PRO Plus Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've been using the Norrona Gore-Tex Pro pant for several seasons so when I saw these I wondered, could they really be that much better?  Bottom line, yes.  The differences are subtle but they add up in the end to an even more superior product.  The mesh lined zippered crotch vents are an absolute godsend on the skin track.  I have also found an improved articulation in the legs.  They retain the bombproof durability of the original, as well as  cannot be beat waterproofness.  You will not get wet.  These pants will keep you spinning laps when the skiing is at it's best.  These are a "plus" pant.
review.name: Worth It
comment: Okay, so you're 5'9" 160lb and you've got a review record showing quite a collection of Norrona ski gear, almost all of it in size L or XL, which you represent as "true to size." I'm 5'9" and have 10 lbs on you at 170lb. My experience has Norrona running a tad large. My purchases have all been size S or M. Are your measurements accurate or do you just like ski clothing on the ultra-loose fitting end of things?

name: Lofoten GORE-TEX PRO Plus Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag like 3-4 years ago and it holds up great still looks new! No water and tear I can tell its made to last a very long time. It was worth the money and is a great everyday mini bag to carry with you like a purse. And I love the black/rainbow color it makes the rainbow color pop out more!
review.name: Built to last & nice for everyday use like a purse

review.reviewBody: I bought the Kanken mini with a chest strap for when Im going on small adventures round the coast and generally need to do some climbing. Im really surprised at how much it can hold and have been using it constantly! Its got enough room to carry my text books for uni with some space left for my water bottle. The side pockets arent very big but Ive found they perfectly fit my iPhone 6 or a small glasses case. I definitely advise buying this bag if you are considering it!
review.name: Best bag I own

review.reviewBody: I have a few minis but this one is my favorite! The colors are vibrant and evenly distributed. Its the perfect size for a short day trip and can carry so much even though it looks small. Its durable and holds up very well in rain and snow.
review.name: Colorful & Bright

review.reviewBody: I love it! Its the perfect size and the colors are amazing!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: This is my second Kanken Mini and I love it! I am always pleased with the durability and comfort, plus I'm a pack rat, and I can always fit everything I need into it without any trouble. I've used them as purses for the last 3 years and i am never every going to use anything else. I cant wait to get another one
review.name: Another wonderful backpack!

review.reviewBody: The blue dye stained a number of objects that were stored in it
review.name: Nicely built but their dying process needs work

review.reviewBody: I purchased this bag months ago and Im still really excited about it. My friends make fun of me a bit because I really dont go anywhere without it and I talk about it all the time still. Its just the perfect size and design. Im now a big fan of the brand overall and am so excited to purchase more in the future!
review.name: Still so excited about this backpack

review.reviewBody: Its really nice and cute and I got got a lot of compliments about my bag I got the purple one and I really love it
review.name: Awesome

name: Kanken Rainbow Mini 7L Backpack

description: Buy the Osprey Packs Fairview 40L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Fairview 40L Backpack - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Fairview 40L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very nice quality. Needs more organizational pockets both on the exterior and interior. Extremely comfortable to carry.
review.name: Very nice quality. Needs more

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love how this pack carries! Such a great buy and fits Al that I need for a few days & more.
review.name: Love how this pack carries!

review.reviewBody: I read and watched a lot of reviews for this backpack. I went to Italy and Croatia for 3 weeks and stuffed it full. It did not feel too heavy for me to carry. The adjustable straps helped with weight distribution on my back. I was surprised but happy that it did fit on a small, express jet airplane in the overhead bin. One of my favorite features is the way the straps have their own hideaway zippy pouch. Right before I got on the plane, standing in line to board, I could tuck my straps away quickly, zip them up and carry it with the side strap. I love this bag! Maximum storage space!!
review.name: Perfect for Europe

review.reviewBody: This is a great pack for both car and airline travel. I pack smart with packing compressors packing cubes but I wouldnt say I pack light and I had plenty of space. The waist belt allows me to comfortably carry this pack through the airport. The straps stow easily and it fits in the overhead bin.
review.name: Packed it all summer

review.reviewBody: This is my favorite travel backpack. It's perfectly sized as a Delta carry-on. It has the Osprey internal support system, that when properly fitted, transfers weight from your shoulders to your hips. I usually can't carry anything over a 25L pack due to an old shoulder injury but can carry this. 3 things to note - 1) it's made for a woman's body with closer shoulder straps & wider hip belt; the man's version is called Farpoint; 2) it will feel clunky if it isn't adjusted peoperly; look on Ospreys website for videos on how to adjust it; and 3) it's a little large to be an underseat personal item, but has always fit well for me in overhead bins even on regional flights.
review.name: Great backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This backpack is great for traveling, especially on a flight. The adjustable straps make it a perfect companion for your back if youre like me and can never find a perfect fit in packs. The straps can be hidden with a zippable cover that is stowed away in a pocket at the bottom of the pack as well. My favorite part of this bag is that the hip belt is durable and comfortable so it makes carrying it easy.
review.name: This backpack is great for

review.reviewBody: I've used the Nine Trails shorts for years (since 2010). I used them for many ultras, day to day running, swimming, backpacking, etc. They were great. So, I was a bit upset that they updated them. Nothing was wrong with the original. Now that I've tried the new ones, I have to admit that they are almost as good. I would have left the zipper on the back pocket, but other than that I've got no real complaints. However, I got the "vessel blue" color. They look great dry, but when they get wet, the color changes completely. That means when you run, it might look like you peed your pants. If that bothers you, get a darker color.
review.name: Great shorts, but get a dark color

review.reviewBody: These are extremely comfortable and lightweight. I have ordered other colors and use them all the time for my workouts and even just lounging. Highly recommend.
review.name: Favorite Shorts

review.reviewBody: Great multi-use shorts, very comfortable.

review.reviewBody: I bought a smaller one for myself and a large for my husband. First, the good is the bill is generous and the material is decent. However, the large was too small for my husband. Also the ear flaps are just that instead of being designed to gently hug, they literally flap around. Glad I didnt toss our old Patagonia ones!
review.name: Mostly okay

review.reviewBody: Wanted a warm winter hat with a small visor. This cap has been perfect. I like that the back flap can be turned up or down depending on how cold it is.
review.name: Soft, light and warm.

review.reviewBody: Really good materials, comfortable! Great hat overall.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: L/XL seems like an average fit. Quality good. Hope 34 yo son will enjoy this winter :)
review.name: Nice cap

review.reviewBody: This is a great and super cozy hat for cold to very cold weather. I have enjoyed wearing it on colder days around the neighborhood, but also used it for a winter ascent of Mt. Washington last Friday and it performed admirably. It's a fine, and uniquely stylish, hat!
review.name: Fantastic Hat

review.reviewBody: Yet another banger for us long haired folks Keeps me warm but not too warm for running and ski touring in the single digits
review.name: Nice

review.reviewBody: Love this hat, perfect for winter runs!
review.name: My new go to winter cap

review.reviewBody: This is a great hat , nice and dense fleece good wind break. If it was just a little bit bigger I would be able to wear the hat. The two hats are too small for me.
review.name: I would buy if they would make it in a larger size.

review.reviewBody: I'm an adult woman with a small head (20.5-inch circumference). I've been looking for a trapper-like fleece hat for the past few years because my ears get cold in winter, and I like having a cap feature to keep the sun out of my eyes. I've seen many online, but they are usually "one size" and not adjustable. I saw this online this week and it was also on sale. Purchased the S/M right away. Just wore it for the first time and it's just what I needed. Most definitely in my top 5 favorite purchases this year, and I rarely buy clothes/shoes these days. Highly recommend!
review.name: Size options AND adjustable!

name: Howling Wind Fleece Cap

hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Chariot Sleek Cup Holder online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This easily clips on and off and generally stays attached well. However, it is so flimsy it cannot hold more than the weight of my child's sippy cup or a disposable coffee cup or small disposable soft drink sized item. So great for the kid, but not great for a parent drink. I tried with my trusty 32 oz steel tumbler and my 20 oz Hydroflask and both of these are too heavy, the cup holder cannot support them and it tips over and falls out. Definitely an underwhelming item of limited utility.
review.name: Flimsy and mediocre
comment:
Thank you for sharing your input on the Thule Sleek Cup Holder. 
The cup holder is designed to hold standard-sized water bottles and conventional cups. Steel tumblers and water bottles are much heavier and higher volume than more commonly-available models and the weight of such items would likely cause other issues with stroller usage. Large items like these may be better stored in the cargo bag underneath the stroller.

review.reviewBody: it doesn't lock. spins way too easily and spills/drops drinks. literally unusable
review.name: the biggest waste of money

review.reviewBody: Pops off easily, was super disappointed but could never figure out a way to make it work
review.name: Agree, functionally useless

review.reviewBody: Good that bracket can be rotated to fit left or right side of the stroller but wish there was a way to lock it in position on preferred side, otherwise it rotates way too easily spilling or dropping drinks.
review.name: Does not stay in position

review.reviewBody: This cup holder does not work. Even a half full paper coffee cup has enough weight to spill over.
review.name: Falls off, spills

review.reviewBody: This cup holder doesnt fit the urban glide and its very loose. This could definitely use some updating to make it better. I had to engineer it a bit to stay on and not be too shaky
review.name: Cup holder could be better

review.reviewBody: The cupholder falls off very easily, and since you can rotate it to fit on either side, it will tip over and spill extremely easy. I bought two of these and took them off within a month due to how annoying they were to use and the number of spills I had.
review.name: Not functional

review.reviewBody: The idea is great but the pivoting arm moves too easily causing drinks to spill. Also, when colapsing the stroller, it pops off
review.name: Falls off easily and rotates too easily and drinks spill

name: Chariot Sleek Cup Holder

review.reviewBody: The jacket is worn daily. It is really light weight and very warm. The size is as described.
review.name: Great Jacket!

review.reviewBody: Ive had this jacket for almost 5 months using it for A daily wearer To a nice  mid layer while Im out at the crag. On its own, it is nice for cold days with no wind when there is wind its good to pair it with a shell. This would be a great jacket for anyone who needs another insulating layer.
review.name: Great puffy

review.reviewBody: Perfect for commute in to the office and in the mountains around town.

I've had more comments on this jacket from others than any jacket I've ever owned. The only issue which I'd personally like changed is that it's just a tad large for the medium. But then again, I have an athletic build and prefer jackets which are form fitting.  Otherwise, this is an amazing choice for those who like the feel and look of down, yet prefer a jacket which isn't a sponge when it rains. Earlier comments on the jacket being severely off sized seem to me to be a bit overstated.....I weigh 175, and am 5'10...And, I love it!
review.name: Amazing Jacket...

review.reviewBody: Solid jacket that gives you a solid 6 hours of water protection when it is down pouring.
review.name: Rain jacket

review.reviewBody:
I have to say - this is a great looking and great performing coat. I would not trade it for any other.

Used it on a blizzard hike with a Gortex shell. My core was super comfortable. Not hot, not cold, not wet-cold. 

When I took off my Gortex, the other dudes on the Summit asked me where I got my jacket.
review.name: Most Stylish and Most Awesome Coat

review.reviewBody: I am 6'2" 150 lbs so very thin. I got a large thinking that would be plenty of room but the shoulders are really restricting enough that i can't even put my arms out without having the jacket pull up and sleeves of the jacket recede down my arms.  Other than fit the jacket seems well made and probably pretty warm.
review.name: Shoulders too restricting

review.reviewBody: I ordered this jacket based on the Mammut sizing chart, and the sizing is a bit off. I appreciate when sites give measurements for models wearing the apparel. That helped in making my decision. The model was said to be 6'3" tall, wearing a size Medium. It appeared there was plenty of arm length, etc. However, when tried this jacket on, the sleeves were just barely long enough for me. Not to mention, if I raise my arms even slightly, it feels as though the whole back is going to rip because it pulls so tightly.  It's a bad fit for something that's supposed to be active/hiking wear.  One should be able to move freely in the jacket. I don't know if the jacket is defective or the sizing is just off. For reference, I'm 6'1" and 180 lbs. I'm pretty slim.  But, this jacket is just off. I tried calling to facilitate an exchange, and was told to use the return label included with the package. There is none, as there are no returns or exchanges through Expert Voice.  Seems like a bad policy, and this will definitely inform my future orders. But, there should be some option for exchange or return; especially when using their recommended sizing charts or for defective product. If it helps anyone else, I would say to size up with this jacket.
review.name: Sizing is off.

review.reviewBody: My son bought this jacket to wear under his shell on the cold days, but now he wears it almost every time he is outside. Under a shell, in place of a shell if it is dry. He just loves the jacket. It looks great, is wearing very well and keeps him so warm.  He is totally happy with his new puffy. Mammut quality it top notch and it looks great. It fits according to size. Nothing about which to complain.
review.name: New favorite item of clothing

review.reviewBody: Very simple and good quality Hooded Men's Jacket. Looks very simple, but keep me warm and comfortable at up to minus 10-15 C
review.name: Warm Hooded Jacket Men

name: Albula IN Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I originally missed this is a relaxed fit. I normally wear a 2x and mistakenly bought a 3x thinking this was going to be fitted as my experience with the brand. The size 3 was too large even with a bulky sweater. The 2x is perfect. The jacket is wonderful. Very thick and cozy. Well constructed. Love it!
review.name: Don't size up

review.reviewBody: Heavier fleece is so comfy and fits so well. I am a bigger woman and 3x is almost too big even for me. A lot pockets to carry things. My new favorite fleece jacket
review.name: LOVE IT

review.reviewBody: I remember wearing the Denali Jacket as a kid so seeing this amazing design brought back for me and my family as an adult has been so fun! I was able to buy me and my daughter starting kindergarten matching purple and pink fleeces for the school year. I feel so blessed to have been able to do that for her and I. review.reviewBody: Compared to Distance, this backpack's material might not be as tough as Dynex, but it offers a much better carrying system, staying stable even when you're running.
review.name: good

review.reviewBody: It is really functional for daily hiking. It can carry what you need during one days trip. And it can fit your back so well that you even ignore the backpack.
review.name: Best Daypack

review.reviewBody:
I'm very picky about backpacks and I've bought and sold a lot. This is one of my favorites for scrabbles and light fast adventures. 
I should have bought the long version, but even so this is a very comfortable bag. I'll defiantly buy the new season model in large back length 

Great layout and holds its shape very well. 
Good pocket layout. 

My only complaint is that the straps to sinch down the bag run on the inside of the main compartment and catch items as you put them in and out, isn't a huge concern but is annoying.
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: This backpack has quickly become my go-to for outdoor adventures! Its lightweight, comfortable, and the perfect size for day trips. The design is sleek yet durable, with plenty of compartments to keep everything organized. I especially appreciate the hydration sleeve and the easy access pockets. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a versatile, reliable backpack!
review.name: Very well made bag.

review.reviewBody: To say I have a backpack for any circumstance is an understatement. I have way TOO many backpacks, and I love having just the pack for my needs. The Pursuit 15 hits an excellent sweet spot for so many different activities. Great day pack for quick hikes, bikes, climbs, etc. Very well thought out design and amazingly comfortable with the wide vest straps. Not many flaws I can pick on, my only wish is that the side pockets could accommodate water bottles easier, but given the ample room for a hydration pack, it easily makes up for it. Homerun from Black Diamond, I won't even bother with other packs at this point! P.S. sign me up to be a gear tester Black Diamond!
review.name: This might just be the unicorn backpack

review.reviewBody: This backpacks fit and function exceeded expectations. Extremely light, and keeps gear close to body without compromising movement. Ideal for bouldering, technical climbing, hiking.
review.name: Best day bag ever

review.reviewBody: I purchased this for my Grand Canyon rim to rim thru hike. I carried about 5 pounds of food, a 2 L Camelback, and 1 L water bottles on both sides in the stretchy pockets. I was also able to attach my InReach to the front shoulder strap easily. It does a great job distributing weight to your hips, even with the lighter waist straps. Shockingly so. I was prob at about 25 pounds in it, def pushing the capacity, but it held up like a champ and never gave me any discomfort on my lumbar spine. Can't recommend enough.
review.name: Great Pack for Rim to Rim Hike

review.reviewBody: Ive been looking for a comfortable day pack for quite some time and Ive finally found it. I have chronic upper back/shoulder pain, so have been in search of a pack that properly distributes weight to the hips. After a few wears, I can say that this pack does the trick. This pack has tons of main compartment room and convenient pockets on the straps. I wish the outer side pockets were designed for a larger water bottle, but the outer pocket in the back middle supports this function, plus there is a compartment for a camel pack. Love this pack!
review.name: Finally, a comfortable day pack

review.reviewBody: I was looking for something to use on long demanding dayhikes and this suits my needs perfectly. Strikes a nice balance between technical features and simplicity in design. I was worried my phone wouldn't fit in the front after reading reviews but I had 0 issues fitting my iphone 14 with a 'commuter' Otterbox. Very, very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Nice sweet spot

review.reviewBody: This pack is the perfect size for me. I like the large, thin hip belt and running vest inspired shoulder straps. It's perfect for longer runs or longer day hikes.
review.name: Nice Pack!

name: Pursuit 15L Backpack

review.reviewBody: These are by far the most comfortable bibs I own and I've owned MANY over the past 25 years. The chamois is amazing! I love the material, the leg grippers, the side pocket and the large reflective accents. The two rear pockets aren't too accessible but are nice to put a key or ID card in. The sizing is WAY small. I originally ordered a large, which I could hardly get on. All my other bibs are L but I'm right on the edge of them being just a little too big. I had to order an XL and they are very snug but they do say these use a more compressive material. The bib straps actually feel a little short as well when I first put them on but don't have any uncomfortableness during a ride. I don't see myself purchasing any other bibs from now on.
review.name: Best bibs I own

name: Supergiara Bib Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: I just received mine today and we used it this afternoon, Well packaged and complete. Quick shipping to Texas. VERY satisfied!
review.name: All and More

review.reviewBody: We are using the JOOLCA nomad to serve as the plumbing in our van conversion. It was so convenient to visit the JOOLCA site and be able to find the needed additional components for our sink as a package. Except for operator error when I inadvertently sprayed myself in the face, the system was installed, connected to our sink, and powered up from our charging station in minutes. We could not be happier.
review.name: Ideal addition

review.reviewBody: Our first shower with the new pump and shower spray unit. The connections on the blue hoses are a lot harder to connect. So far so good. Everything needed was included. The unit feels solid.
review.name: First Run

review.reviewBody:
Initial impression when I got my first setup was very impressed. the first unit I got only lasted 6 uses then it sprung a leak. I bought a new unit and is still working. The pump broke and I had to buy another one. I dissasembeled the original pump and found that the bearing seized up. I was able to replace the bearing and have the pump as a backup.

I probably would not buy another one as the build quality and durability isn't what I would expect for the price point
review.name: Great concept and easy to use but not reliable.

name: Off-Grid Plumbing

description: Buy the Shimano XTR PD-M9100 Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: XTR PD-M9100 Pedals
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano XTR PD-M9100 Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: XTR PD-M9100 Pedals
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano XTR PD-M9100 Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my new Landshark tandem.  They are light and smoothe.  My last 9100 pedals are going strong after over 5000 miles.  I'm not too good at cleaning and maintaining them but they don't seem to mind.  I don't think you can really wear these out! Are they worth the extra from the lower models? I can't say but I wanted the lightest and still most reliable.
review.name: Still the gold standard for me

review.reviewBody: I have been using Shimano XTR pedals for 15+ years on several bikes.  I think I have had two mechanicals in that entire time.  Last one was my fault for a pedal strike at 20'ish mph that bent the pedal, chain and cassette.  That should give you an idea of how hard I ride them!
review.name: Solid Pedals

review.reviewBody: I have used SPD pedals for years, multiple brands but the XTR PD-9100 pedals are the best to me - they are light and stiff with long-lasting quality.
review.name: Light and stiff pedals!

review.reviewBody:
As pedals, they do their job very well and feel smooth and lightweight. Nothing to complain about there.

However, the outside edge of the pedal (the section of the body in-line with the pedal axle) is an absolute shin/ankle/thigh demolisher... it has a bit of a duckbill shape meaning it has two sharper-than-necessary edges to catch skin. Somewhat upsetting on as pricey a pair as these
review.name: Sharper than they loook

review.reviewBody: The classic XT or XTRpedals are great and engage - never any issues and are durable - either version has the best overall performance - highly recommended
review.name: Great pedals - easy to engage

review.reviewBody: What else is there to say about the most rock solid pedals is cycling? The XTR's sacrifice some durability for weight savings but are still reliable. I went with the XTR for my wife's Juliana Quincy CC gravel bike. The bike is very light for a gravel set up and only made sense to continue with that design. In my opinion pedals and wheels are the two best places to save weight on a bike. Worth the extra money on a premium bike. That being said XT's still a fantastic option.
review.name: Old Faithful

review.reviewBody: These pedals just work! I've really put them through a lot of abuse recently in mud, sand, dirt, and rocks and have had no issues whatsoever.
review.name: They work and work well

name: XTR PD-M9100 Pedals

hasVariant.name: Anatomica Boxer + Fly - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Icebreaker Anatomica Boxer + Fly - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband loves these and he can get hot easily. Very breathable. He likes to wear them all day, even to sleep. He orders a M and is 5'8" 165LBS.
review.name: I would buy this product again and again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable, bout it to keep me warm while hiking in the mountains and so far it has succeeded at that mission, although they're still new and I haven't tried and big trips or serious climbs as yet.
review.name: Solid product

review.reviewBody: I've been wearing these underwear for years and every single pair wears out in the thigh quickly and I end up putting a finger or a toe through the thigh. I've moved on from expensive junk to moderately priced quality. I recommend you do the same, shop around!
review.name: paper thin

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice fit, comfortable and most importantly, they do have a sex appeal as advertised.
review.name: Your privates will thank you

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this Merino blend boxer, as well as the 100% Merino boxer at the same time. I prefer the fit of this Merino blend boxer because it has a bit more stretch & is cut in a more trim-fit. If I buy Merino boxers again, this Merino 150 is what I will get.
review.name: I would buy this again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely love this product they are the best underwear on the market period. I've been using them for over 10 years.
review.name: Merino mens underwear

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like the material but the tags are huge and they cannot be easily removed. I doubt that this is due to some regulation but, combined with the pricing, looks like they will not improve if they do not have to and they will milk every cent out of you that they can. Not recommended.
review.name: Tags are terrible, overpriced.

review.reviewBody: Yeah... I should have known better. I'm stuck with 2 pairs of these. They ride up more than any other pair of boxer briefs I own. Really disappointed. I'd purchased a similar pair from Icebreaker many years ago and had the same problem. I was hopeful they'd resolved the issue based on some positive reviews. Not so much for me. I like the fabric and overall look, but the only boxer briefs from Icebreaker that work reasonably well for me are the Anatomica Long Boxers. They lose their shape a bit over time, but they don't ride up like these.
review.name: Did anyone mention they ride up??

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are great for hiking. They are cool, comfortable, and fit well. They also dry out quickly when hung up. These are great for daily use, but at the price point, I save them for outdoor activities.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just got them and wore them on recent hiking/camping trip. Very comfortable so far. Appear to be well made. Will see over time. Did buy a size up from the chart and they fit well, not tight but not loose. Perfect for underware.
review.name: Comfortable

name: Anatomica Boxer + Fly - Men's
